intro: Tephroseris coincyi, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Tephroseris coincyi is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
